news.title: Net migration 20% lower than first thought as more British nationals left UK
news.summary: The figures also reveal migration peaked 38,000 higher than previously reported in the year to March 2023.

news.title: Google boss says trillion-dollar AI investment boom has 'elements of irrationality'
news.summary: In an exclusive BBC interview, Sundar Pichai hailed artificial intelligence as an "extraordinary moment" but said no company would be immune if bubble burst.

news.title: Don't blindly trust what AI tells you, says Google's Sundar Pichai
news.summary: Sundar Pichai candidly acknowledged concerns about inaccurate answers generated by Google's models.

news.title: MI5 warns MPs and peers over risk of Chinese espionage
news.summary: Security services have issued a new "espionage alert" to members of the House of Commons and Lords.

news.title: How serious is Labour backlash over asylum plans?
news.summary: Many of the government’s own MPs are uneasy about the proposals – not just the usual critics.

news.title: New ticketing laws will ban resales above face value. So how much will fans save?
news.summary: A proposed law will make it illegal to resell tickets for events such as concerts above face value.

news.title: 'I hated that I looked Asian': KPop Demon Hunters star on her struggle for acceptance
news.summary: Korean-American actress Arden Cho tells BBC Global Women she struggled to feel accepted while growing up in Texas.

news.title: US to sell F-35s to Saudi Arabia, Trump says ahead of crown prince's visit
news.summary: Trump will welcome Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to the White House for the first time since Jamal Khashoggi's murder.

news.title: StubHub and Wayfair among firms named in online pricing investigation
news.summary: The Competition and Markets Authority is taking the action following a review of online pricing and sales practices.

news.title: Once-extinct wildcats to make a comeback in England
news.summary: Fifty wildcats could be reintroduced to the countryside in south west England, conservationists say.
